    2907             : /*
    2908             :  * Display a sort/group clause.
    2909             :  *
    2910             :  * Also returns the expression tree, so caller need not find it again.
    2911             :  */
    2912             : static Node *
    2913        5069 : get_rule_sortgroupclause(Index ref, List *tlist, bool force_colno,
    2914             :                          deparse_context *context)
    2915             : {
    2916        5069 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    2917             :     TargetEntry *tle;
    2918             :     Node       *expr;
    2919             : 
    2920        5069 :     tle = get_sortgroupref_tle(ref, tlist);
    2921        5069 :     expr = (Node *) tle->expr;
    2922             : 
    2923             :     /*
    2924             :      * Use column-number form if requested by caller.  Otherwise, if
    2925             :      * expression is a constant, force it to be dumped with an explicit cast
    2926             :      * as decoration --- this is because a simple integer constant is
    2927             :      * ambiguous (and will be misinterpreted by findTargetlistEntry()) if we
    2928             :      * dump it without any decoration.  If it's anything more complex than a
    2929             :      * simple Var, then force extra parens around it, to ensure it can't be
    2930             :      * misinterpreted as a cube() or rollup() construct.
    2931             :      */
    2932        5069 :     if (force_colno)
    2933             :     {
    2934             :         Assert(!tle->resjunk);
    2935           0 :         appendStringInfo(buf, "%d", tle->resno);
    2936             :     }
    2937        5069 :     else if (expr && IsA(expr, Const))
    2938        4605 :         get_const_expr((Const *) expr, context, 1);
    2939         464 :     else if (!expr || IsA(expr, Var))
    2940         230 :         get_rule_expr(expr, context, true);
    2941             :     else
    2942             :     {
    2943             :         /*
    2944             :          * We must force parens for function-like expressions even if
    2945             :          * PRETTY_PAREN is off, since those are the ones in danger of
    2946             :          * misparsing. For other expressions we need to force them only if
    2947             :          * PRETTY_PAREN is on, since otherwise the expression will output them
    2948             :          * itself. (We can't skip the parens.)
    2949             :          */
    2950         468 :         bool        need_paren = (PRETTY_PAREN(context)
    2951         234 :                                   || IsA(expr, FuncExpr)
    2952         234 :                                   || IsA(expr, Aggref)
    2953         468 :                                   || IsA(expr, WindowFunc));
    2954             : 
    2955         234 :         if (need_paren)
    2956           0 :             appendStringInfoChar(context->buf, '(');
    2957         234 :         get_rule_expr(expr, context, true);
    2958         234 :         if (need_paren)
    2959           0 :             appendStringInfoChar(context->buf, ')');
    2960             :     }
    2961             : 
    2962        5069 :     return expr;
    2963             : }

    3425             : 
    3426             :     /*
    3427             :      * Start the query with UPDATE relname SET
    3428             :      */
    3429           0 :     rte = rt_fetch(query->resultRelation, query->rtable);
    3430             : 
    3431           0 :     if (PRETTY_INDENT(context))
    3432             :     {
    3433           0 :         appendStringInfoChar(buf, ' ');
    3434           0 :         context->indentLevel += PRETTYINDENT_STD;
    3435             :     }
    3436             : 
    3437             :     /* if it's a shard, do differently */

    3492             : /* ----------
    3493             :  * get_update_query_targetlist_def          - Parse back an UPDATE targetlist

    3495             :  */
    3496             : static void
    3497           0 : get_update_query_targetlist_def(Query *query, List *targetList,
    3498             :                                 deparse_context *context, RangeTblEntry *rte)
    3499             : {
    3500           0 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    3501             :     ListCell   *l;
    3502             :     ListCell   *next_ma_cell;
    3503             :     int         remaining_ma_columns;
    3504             :     const char *sep;
    3505             :     SubLink    *cur_ma_sublink;
    3506             :     List       *ma_sublinks;
    3507             : 
    3508             :     /*
    3509             :      * Prepare to deal with MULTIEXPR assignments: collect the source SubLinks
    3510             :      * into a list.  We expect them to appear, in ID order, in resjunk tlist
    3511             :      * entries.
    3512             :      */
    3513           0 :     ma_sublinks = NIL;
    3514           0 :     if (query->hasSubLinks)      /* else there can't be any */
    3515             :     {
    3516           0 :         foreach(l, targetList)
    3517             :         {
    3518           0 :             TargetEntry *tle = (TargetEntry *) lfirst(l);
    3519             : 
    3520           0 :             if (tle->resjunk && IsA(tle->expr, SubLink))
    3521             :             {
    3522           0 :                 SubLink    *sl = (SubLink *) tle->expr;
    3523             : 
    3524           0 :                 if (sl->subLinkType == MULTIEXPR_SUBLINK)
    3525             :                 {
    3526           0 :                     ma_sublinks = lappend(ma_sublinks, sl);
    3527             :                     Assert(sl->subLinkId == list_length(ma_sublinks));
    3528             :                 }
    3529             :             }
    3530             :         }
    3531             :     }
    3532           0 :     next_ma_cell = list_head(ma_sublinks);
    3533           0 :     cur_ma_sublink = NULL;
    3534           0 :     remaining_ma_columns = 0;
    3535             : 
    3536             :     /* Add the comma separated list of 'attname = value' */
    3537           0 :     sep = "";
    3538           0 :     foreach(l, targetList)
    3539             :     {
    3540           0 :         TargetEntry *tle = (TargetEntry *) lfirst(l);
    3541             :         Node       *expr;
    3542             : 
    3543           0 :         if (tle->resjunk)
    3544           0 :             continue;           /* ignore junk entries */
    3545             : 
    3546             :         /* Emit separator (OK whether we're in multiassignment or not) */
    3547           0 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, sep);
    3548           0 :         sep = ", ";
    3549             : 
    3550             :         /*
    3551             :          * Check to see if we're starting a multiassignment group: if so,
    3552             :          * output a left paren.
    3553             :          */
    3554           0 :         if (next_ma_cell != NULL && cur_ma_sublink == NULL)
    3555             :         {
    3556             :             /*
    3557             :              * We must dig down into the expr to see if it's a PARAM_MULTIEXPR
    3558             :              * Param.  That could be buried under FieldStores and
    3559             :              * SubscriptingRefs and CoerceToDomains (cf processIndirection()),
    3560             :              * and underneath those there could be an implicit type coercion.
    3561             :              * Because we would ignore implicit type coercions anyway, we
    3562             :              * don't need to be as careful as processIndirection() is about
    3563             :              * descending past implicit CoerceToDomains.
    3564             :              */
    3565           0 :             expr = (Node *) tle->expr;
    3566           0 :             while (expr)
    3567             :             {
    3568           0 :                 if (IsA(expr, FieldStore))
    3569             :                 {
    3570           0 :                     FieldStore *fstore = (FieldStore *) expr;
    3571             : 
    3572           0 :                     expr = (Node *) linitial(fstore->newvals);
    3573             :                 }
    3574           0 :                 else if (IsA(expr, SubscriptingRef))
    3575             :                 {
    3576           0 :                     SubscriptingRef *sbsref = (SubscriptingRef *) expr;
    3577             : 
    3578           0 :                     if (sbsref->refassgnexpr == NULL)
    3579           0 :                         break;
    3580           0 :                     expr = (Node *) sbsref->refassgnexpr;
    3581             :                 }
    3582           0 :                 else if (IsA(expr, CoerceToDomain))
    3583             :                 {
    3584           0 :                     CoerceToDomain *cdomain = (CoerceToDomain *) expr;
    3585             : 
    3586           0 :                     if (cdomain->coercionformat != COERCE_IMPLICIT_CAST)
    3587           0 :                         break;
    3588           0 :                     expr = (Node *) cdomain->arg;
    3589             :                 }
    3590             :                 else
    3591           0 :                     break;
    3592             :             }
    3593           0 :             expr = strip_implicit_coercions(expr);
    3594             : 
    3595           0 :             if (expr && IsA(expr, Param) &&
    3596           0 :                 ((Param *) expr)->paramkind == PARAM_MULTIEXPR)
    3597             :             {
    3598           0 :                 cur_ma_sublink = (SubLink *) lfirst(next_ma_cell);
    3599           0 :                 next_ma_cell = lnext(ma_sublinks, next_ma_cell);
    3600           0 :                 remaining_ma_columns = count_nonjunk_tlist_entries(
    3601           0 :                                                                    ((Query *) cur_ma_sublink->subselect)->targetList);
    3602             :                 Assert(((Param *) expr)->paramid ==
    3603             :                        ((cur_ma_sublink->subLinkId << 16) | 1));
    3604           0 :                 appendStringInfoChar(buf, '(');
    3605             :             }
    3606             :         }
    3607             : 
    3608             :         /*
    3609             :          * Put out name of target column; look in the catalogs, not at
    3610             :          * tle->resname, since resname will fail to track RENAME.
    3611             :          */

    3613           0 :                                quote_identifier(get_attname(rte->relid,
    3614           0 :                                                             tle->resno,
    3615             :                                                             false)));

    3622             : 
    3623             :         /*

    3629             :         {
    3630           0 :             if (--remaining_ma_columns > 0)
    3631           0 :                 continue;       /* not the last column of multiassignment */
    3632           0 :             appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    3633           0 :             expr = (Node *) cur_ma_sublink;
    3634           0 :             cur_ma_sublink = NULL;
    3635             :         }
    3636             : 
    3637           0 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, " = ");

    3639           0 :         get_rule_expr(expr, context, false);
    3640             :     }

    3784             :     }

    3790             :

    3793             :                              -PRETTYINDENT_STD, PRETTYINDENT_STD, 1);

    3795             : 
    3796             :         /* Add optional AND <condition> */
    3797           0 :         if (action->qual)
    3798             :         {
    3799           0 :             appendContextKeyword(context, " AND ",
    3800             :                              -PRETTYINDENT_STD, PRETTYINDENT_STD, 1);
    3801           0 :             get_rule_expr(action->qual, context, false);
    3802             :         }
    3803             : 
    3804           0 :         appendContextKeyword(context, " THEN",
    3805             :                          -PRETTYINDENT_STD, PRETTYINDENT_STD, 1);
    3806             : 
    3807           0 :         switch (action->commandType)
    3808             :         {
    3809           0 :             case CMD_INSERT:
    3810             :             {
    3811           0 :                 appendStringInfo(buf, " INSERT " );
    3812           0 :                 List *strippedexprs = NIL;
    3813             : 
    3814           0 :                 if (action->targetList)
    3815             :                 {
    3816           0 :                     strippedexprs = get_insert_column_names_list(action->targetList,
    3817             :                                         buf, context, targetRte);
    3818             :                 }
    3819             : 
    3820           0 :                 if (strippedexprs)
    3821             :                 {
    3822             :                     /* Add the single-VALUES expression list */
    3823           0 :                     appendContextKeyword(context, "VALUES (",
    3824             :                                          -PRETTYINDENT_STD, PRETTYINDENT_STD, 2);
    3825           0 :                     get_rule_list_toplevel(strippedexprs, context, false);
    3826           0 :                     appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    3827             :                 }
    3828             :                 else
    3829             :                 {
    3830             :                     /* No expressions, so it must be DEFAULT VALUES */
    3831           0 :                     appendStringInfoString(buf, "DEFAULT VALUES");
    3832             :                 }
    3833             :             }
    3834           0 :             break;
    3835             : 
    3836           0 :             case CMD_UPDATE:
    3837           0 :                 appendStringInfo(buf, " UPDATE SET " );
    3838           0 :                 get_update_query_targetlist_def(query, action->targetList,
    3839             :                                     context, targetRte);
    3840           0 :                 break;
    3841             : 
    3842           0 :             case CMD_DELETE:
    3843           0 :                 appendStringInfo(buf, " DELETE" );
    3844           0 :                 break;
    3845             : 
    3846           0 :             case CMD_NOTHING:
    3847           0 :                 appendStringInfo(buf, " DO NOTHING " );
    3848           0 :                 break;
    3849             : 
    3850           0 :             default:
    3851           0 :                 elog(ERROR, "unknown action in MERGE WHEN clause");
    3852             :         }
    3853             :     }
    3854             : 
    3855             :     /*
    3856             :      * RETURNING is not supported in MERGE, so it must be NULL, but if PG adds it later,

    3858             :      */

    3860             :     {

    3862             :     }
    3863             : 
    3864           0 :     ereport(DEBUG1, (errmsg("<Deparsed MERGE query: %s>", buf->data)));
    3865           0 : }

    3868             : /* ----------
    3869             :  * get_utility_query_def            - Parse back a UTILITY parsetree
    3870             :  * ----------
    3871             :  */
    3872             : static void
    3873           0 : get_utility_query_def(Query *query, deparse_context *context)
    3874             : {
    3875           0 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    3876             : 
    3877           0 :     if (query->utilityStmt && IsA(query->utilityStmt, NotifyStmt))
    3878           0 :     {
    3879           0 :         NotifyStmt *stmt = (NotifyStmt *) query->utilityStmt;
    3880             : 
    3881           0 :         appendContextKeyword(context, "",
    3882             :                              0, PRETTYINDENT_STD, 1);
    3883           0 :         appendStringInfo(buf, "NOTIFY %s",
    3884           0 :                          quote_identifier(stmt->conditionname));
    3885           0 :         if (stmt->payload)
    3886             :         {
    3887           0 :             appendStringInfoString(buf, ", ");
    3888           0 :             simple_quote_literal(buf, stmt->payload);
    3889             :         }
    3890             :     }
    3891           0 :     else if (query->utilityStmt && IsA(query->utilityStmt, TruncateStmt))
    3892           0 :     {
    3893           0 :         TruncateStmt *stmt = (TruncateStmt *) query->utilityStmt;
    3894           0 :         List *relationList = stmt->relations;
    3895           0 :         ListCell *relationCell = NULL;
    3896             : 
    3897           0 :         appendContextKeyword(context, "",
    3898             :                              0, PRETTYINDENT_STD, 1);
    3899             : 
    3900           0 :         appendStringInfo(buf, "TRUNCATE TABLE");
    3901             : 
    3902           0 :         foreach(relationCell, relationList)
    3903             :         {
    3904           0 :             RangeVar *relationVar = (RangeVar *) lfirst(relationCell);
    3905           0 :             Oid relationId = RangeVarGetRelid(relationVar, NoLock, false);
    3906           0 :             char *relationName = generate_relation_or_shard_name(relationId,
    3907             :                                                                  context->distrelid,
    3908             :                                                                  context->shardid, NIL);
    3909           0 :             appendStringInfo(buf, " %s", relationName);
    3910             : 
    3911           0 :             if (lnext(relationList, relationCell) != NULL)
    3912             :             {
    3913           0 :                 appendStringInfo(buf, ",");
    3914             :             }
    3915             :         }
    3916             : 
    3917           0 :         if (stmt->restart_seqs)
    3918             :         {
    3919           0 :             appendStringInfo(buf, " RESTART IDENTITY");
    3920             :         }
    3921             : 
    3922           0 :         if (stmt->behavior == DROP_CASCADE)
    3923             :         {
    3924           0 :             appendStringInfo(buf, " CASCADE");
    3925             :         }
    3926             :     }
    3927             :     else
    3928             :     {
    3929             :         /* Currently only NOTIFY utility commands can appear in rules */
    3930           0 :         elog(ERROR, "unexpected utility statement type");
    3931             :     }
    3932           0 : }
    3933             : 
    3934             : /*
    3935             :  * Display a Var appropriately.
    3936             :  *
    3937             :  * In some cases (currently only when recursing into an unnamed join)
    3938             :  * the Var's varlevelsup has to be interpreted with respect to a context
    3939             :  * above the current one; levelsup indicates the offset.
    3940             :  *
    3941             :  * If istoplevel is true, the Var is at the top level of a SELECT's
    3942             :  * targetlist, which means we need special treatment of whole-row Vars.
    3943             :  * Instead of the normal "tab.*", we'll print "tab.*::typename", which is a
    3944             :  * dirty hack to prevent "tab.*" from being expanded into multiple columns.
    3945             :  * (The parser will strip the useless coercion, so no inefficiency is added in
    3946             :  * dump and reload.)  We used to print just "tab" in such cases, but that is
    3947             :  * ambiguous and will yield the wrong result if "tab" is also a plain column
    3948             :  * name in the query.
    3949             :  *
    3950             :  * Returns the attname of the Var, or NULL if the Var has no attname (because
    3951             :  * it is a whole-row Var or a subplan output reference).
    3952             :  */
    3953             : static char *
    3954       40169 : get_variable(Var *var, int levelsup, bool istoplevel, deparse_context *context)
    3955             : {
    3956       40169 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;

    3958             :     AttrNumber  attnum;
    3959             :     int     varno;
    3960             :     AttrNumber  varattno;
    3961             :     int         netlevelsup;
    3962             :     deparse_namespace *dpns;
    3963             :     deparse_columns *colinfo;
    3964             :     char       *refname;
    3965             :     char       *attname;
    3966             :

    3973             :                                           netlevelsup);

    3981             :

    4058             :     /*
    4059             :      * The planner will sometimes emit Vars referencing resjunk elements of a
    4060             :      * subquery's target list (this is currently only possible if it chooses
    4061             :      * to generate a "physical tlist" for a SubqueryScan or CteScan node).
    4062             :      * Although we prefer to print subquery-referencing Vars using the
    4063             :      * subquery's alias, that's not possible for resjunk items since they have
    4064             :      * no alias.  So in that case, drill down to the subplan and print the
    4065             :      * contents of the referenced tlist item.  This works because in a plan
    4066             :      * tree, such Vars can only occur in a SubqueryScan or CteScan node, and
    4067             :      * we'll have set dpns->inner_plan to reference the child plan node.
    4068             :      */

    4071           0 :         dpns->inner_plan)
    4072             :     {

    4097             : 
    4098             :     /*
    4099             :      * If it's an unnamed join, look at the expansion of the alias variable.
    4100             :      * If it's a simple reference to one of the input vars, then recursively
    4101             :      * print the name of that var instead.  When it's not a simple reference,
    4102             :      * we have to just print the unqualified join column name.  (This can only
    4103             :      * happen with "dangerous" merged columns in a JOIN USING; we took pains
    4104             :      * previously to make the unqualified column name unique in such cases.)
    4105             :      *

    4108             :      * contain a join alias variable.
    4109             :      */

    4197             : /*

    4204             : static void

    4207           0 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;

    4238           0 :         return;
    4239             :     }
    4240             : 
    4241             :     /* Find appropriate nesting depth */

    4310             : 
    4311             : /*
    4312             :  * Get the name of a field of an expression of composite type.  The
    4313             :  * expression is usually a Var, but we handle other cases too.
    4314             :  *
    4315             :  * levelsup is an extra offset to interpret the Var's varlevelsup correctly.
    4316             :  *
    4317             :  * This is fairly straightforward when the expression has a named composite
    4318             :  * type; we need only look up the type in the catalogs.  However, the type
    4319             :  * could also be RECORD.  Since no actual table or view column is allowed to
    4320             :  * have type RECORD, a Var of type RECORD must refer to a JOIN or FUNCTION RTE
    4321             :  * or to a subquery output.  We drill down to find the ultimate defining
    4322             :  * expression and attempt to infer the field name from it.  We ereport if we
    4323             :  * can't determine the name.
    4324             :  *
    4325             :  * Similarly, a PARAM of type RECORD has to refer to some expression of
    4326             :  * a determinable composite type.
    4327             :  */
    4328             : static const char *
    4329           0 : get_name_for_var_field(Var *var, int fieldno,
    4330             :                        int levelsup, deparse_context *context)
    4331             : {
    4332             :     RangeTblEntry *rte;
    4333             :     AttrNumber  attnum;
    4334             :     int         netlevelsup;
    4335             :     deparse_namespace *dpns;
    4336             :     int     varno;
    4337             :     AttrNumber  varattno;
    4338             :     TupleDesc   tupleDesc;
    4339             :     Node       *expr;
    4340             : 
    4341             :     /*
    4342             :      * If it's a RowExpr that was expanded from a whole-row Var, use the
    4343             :      * column names attached to it.
    4344             :      */
    4345           0 :     if (IsA(var, RowExpr))
    4346             :     {
    4347           0 :         RowExpr    *r = (RowExpr *) var;
    4348             : 
    4349           0 :         if (fieldno > 0 && fieldno <= list_length(r->colnames))
    4350           0 :             return strVal(list_nth(r->colnames, fieldno - 1));
    4351             :     }
    4352             : 
    4353             :     /*
    4354             :      * If it's a Param of type RECORD, try to find what the Param refers to.
    4355             :      */
    4356           0 :     if (IsA(var, Param))
    4357             :     {
    4358           0 :         Param      *param = (Param *) var;
    4359             :         ListCell   *ancestor_cell;
    4360             : 
    4361           0 :         expr = find_param_referent(param, context, &dpns, &ancestor_cell);
    4362           0 :         if (expr)
    4363             :         {
    4364             :             /* Found a match, so recurse to decipher the field name */
    4365             :             deparse_namespace save_dpns;
    4366             :             const char *result;
    4367             : 
    4368           0 :             push_ancestor_plan(dpns, ancestor_cell, &save_dpns);
    4369           0 :             result = get_name_for_var_field((Var *) expr, fieldno,
    4370             :                                             0, context);
    4371           0 :             pop_ancestor_plan(dpns, &save_dpns);
    4372           0 :             return result;
    4373             :         }
    4374             :     }
    4375             : 
    4376             :     /*
    4377             :      * If it's a Var of type RECORD, we have to find what the Var refers to;
    4378             :      * if not, we can use get_expr_result_tupdesc().
    4379             :      */
    4380           0 :     if (!IsA(var, Var) ||
    4381           0 :         var->vartype != RECORDOID)
    4382             :     {
    4383           0 :         tupleDesc = get_expr_result_tupdesc((Node *) var, false);
    4384             :         /* Got the tupdesc, so we can extract the field name */
    4385             :         Assert(fieldno >= 1 && fieldno <= tupleDesc->natts);
    4386           0 :         return NameStr(TupleDescAttr(tupleDesc, fieldno - 1)->attname);
    4387             :     }
    4388             : 
    4389             :     /* Find appropriate nesting depth */
    4390           0 :     netlevelsup = var->varlevelsup + levelsup;
    4391           0 :     if (netlevelsup >= list_length(context->namespaces))
    4392           0 :         elog(ERROR, "bogus varlevelsup: %d offset %d",
    4393             :              var->varlevelsup, levelsup);
    4394           0 :     dpns = (deparse_namespace *) list_nth(context->namespaces,
    4395             :                                           netlevelsup);
    4396             : 
    4397           0 :     varno = var->varno;
    4398           0 :     varattno = var->varattno;
    4399             : 
    4400           0 :     if (var->varnosyn > 0 && var->varnosyn <= list_length(dpns->rtable) && dpns->plan == NULL) {
    4401           0 :         rte = rt_fetch(var->varnosyn, dpns->rtable);
    4402             : 
    4403             :         /*
    4404             :          * if the rte var->varnosyn points to is not a regular table and it is a join
    4405             :          * then the correct relname will be found with var->varnosyn and var->varattnosyn
    4406             :          */
    4407           0 :         if (rte->rtekind == RTE_JOIN && rte->relid == 0 && var->varnosyn != var->varno) {
    4408           0 :             varno = var->varnosyn;
    4409           0 :             varattno = var->varattnosyn;
    4410             :         }
    4411             :     }
    4412             : 
    4413             :     /*
    4414             :      * Try to find the relevant RTE in this rtable.  In a plan tree, it's

    4714             : /*

    4717             :  *

    4844             :             }

    4855             : /*

    4907             : 
    4908           0 :         pop_ancestor_plan(dpns, &save_dpns);
    4909             :

    4911             :     }
    4912             : 
    4913             :     /*
    4914             :      * If it's an external parameter, see if the outermost namespace provides

    4923             :         {

    4925             : 
    4926           0 :             if (argname)
    4927             :             {
    4928           0 :                 bool        should_qualify = false;

    4931             :                 /*

    4943           0 :                         should_qualify = true;
    4944           0 :                         break;
    4945             :                     }

    4976             : /*
    4977             :  * get_simple_binary_op_name

    4979             :  * helper function for isSimpleNode

    4981             :  */
    4982             : static const char *
    4983           0 : get_simple_binary_op_name(OpExpr *expr)
    4984             : {
    4985           0 :     List       *args = expr->args;
    4986             : 
    4987           0 :     if (list_length(args) == 2)
    4988             :     {
    4989             :         /* binary operator */
    4990           0 :         Node       *arg1 = (Node *) linitial(args);
    4991           0 :         Node       *arg2 = (Node *) lsecond(args);
    4992             :         const char *op;
    4993             : 
    4994           0 :         op = generate_operator_name(expr->opno, exprType(arg1), exprType(arg2));
    4995           0 :         if (strlen(op) == 1)
    4996           0 :             return op;
    4997             :     }
    4998           0 :     return NULL;
    4999             : }
    5000             : 
    5001             : /*
    5002             :  * isSimpleNode - check if given node is simple (doesn't need parenthesizing)
    5003             :  *
    5004             :  *  true   : simple in the context of parent node's type
    5005             :  *  false  : not simple
    5006             :  */
    5007             : static bool
    5008           0 : isSimpleNode(Node *node, Node *parentNode, int prettyFlags)
    5009             : {
    5010           0 :     if (!node)
    5011           0 :         return false;
    5012             : 
    5013           0 :     switch (nodeTag(node))
    5014             :     {
    5015           0 :         case T_Var:
    5016             :         case T_Const:
    5017             :         case T_Param:
    5018             :         case T_CoerceToDomainValue:
    5019             :         case T_SetToDefault:
    5020             :         case T_CurrentOfExpr:
    5021             :             /* single words: always simple */
    5022           0 :             return true;
    5023             : 
    5024           0 :         case T_SubscriptingRef:
    5025             :         case T_ArrayExpr:
    5026             :         case T_RowExpr:
    5027             :         case T_CoalesceExpr:
    5028             :         case T_MinMaxExpr:
    5029             :         case T_SQLValueFunction:
    5030             :         case T_XmlExpr:
    5031             :         case T_NextValueExpr:
    5032             :         case T_NullIfExpr:
    5033             :         case T_Aggref:
    5034             :         case T_GroupingFunc:
    5035             :         case T_WindowFunc:
    5036             :         case T_FuncExpr:
    5037             :             /* function-like: name(..) or name[..] */
    5038           0 :             return true;
    5039             : 
    5040             :             /* CASE keywords act as parentheses */
    5041           0 :         case T_CaseExpr:
    5042           0 :             return true;
    5043             : 
    5044           0 :         case T_FieldSelect:
    5045             : 
    5046             :             /*
    5047             :              * appears simple since . has top precedence, unless parent is
    5048             :              * T_FieldSelect itself!
    5049             :              */
    5050           0 :             return !IsA(parentNode, FieldSelect);
    5051             : 
    5052           0 :         case T_FieldStore:
    5053             : 
    5054             :             /*
    5055             :              * treat like FieldSelect (probably doesn't matter)
    5056             :              */
    5057           0 :             return !IsA(parentNode, FieldStore);
    5058             : 
    5059           0 :         case T_CoerceToDomain:
    5060             :             /* maybe simple, check args */
    5061           0 :             return isSimpleNode((Node *) ((CoerceToDomain *) node)->arg,
    5062             :                                 node, prettyFlags);
    5063           0 :         case T_RelabelType:
    5064           0 :             return isSimpleNode((Node *) ((RelabelType *) node)->arg,
    5065             :                                 node, prettyFlags);
    5066           0 :         case T_CoerceViaIO:
    5067           0 :             return isSimpleNode((Node *) ((CoerceViaIO *) node)->arg,
    5068             :                                 node, prettyFlags);
    5069           0 :         case T_ArrayCoerceExpr:
    5070           0 :             return isSimpleNode((Node *) ((ArrayCoerceExpr *) node)->arg,
    5071             :                                 node, prettyFlags);
    5072           0 :         case T_ConvertRowtypeExpr:
    5073           0 :             return isSimpleNode((Node *) ((ConvertRowtypeExpr *) node)->arg,
    5074             :                                 node, prettyFlags);
    5075             : 
    5076           0 :         case T_OpExpr:
    5077             :             {
    5078             :                 /* depends on parent node type; needs further checking */
    5079           0 :                 if (prettyFlags & PRETTYFLAG_PAREN && IsA(parentNode, OpExpr))
    5080             :                 {
    5081             :                     const char *op;
    5082             :                     const char *parentOp;
    5083             :                     bool        is_lopriop;
    5084             :                     bool        is_hipriop;
    5085             :                     bool        is_lopriparent;
    5086             :                     bool        is_hipriparent;
    5087             : 
    5088           0 :                     op = get_simple_binary_op_name((OpExpr *) node);
    5089           0 :                     if (!op)
    5090           0 :                         return false;
    5091             : 
    5092             :                     /* We know only the basic operators + - and * / % */
    5093           0 :                     is_lopriop = (strchr("+-", *op) != NULL);
    5094           0 :                     is_hipriop = (strchr("*/%", *op) != NULL);
    5095           0 :                     if (!(is_lopriop || is_hipriop))
    5096           0 :                         return false;
    5097             : 
    5098           0 :                     parentOp = get_simple_binary_op_name((OpExpr *) parentNode);
    5099           0 :                     if (!parentOp)
    5100           0 :                         return false;
    5101             : 
    5102           0 :                     is_lopriparent = (strchr("+-", *parentOp) != NULL);
    5103           0 :                     is_hipriparent = (strchr("*/%", *parentOp) != NULL);
    5104           0 :                     if (!(is_lopriparent || is_hipriparent))
    5105           0 :                         return false;
    5106             : 
    5107           0 :                     if (is_hipriop && is_lopriparent)
    5108           0 :                         return true;    /* op binds tighter than parent */
    5109             : 
    5110           0 :                     if (is_lopriop && is_hipriparent)
    5111           0 :                         return false;
    5112             : 
    5113             :                     /*
    5114             :                      * Operators are same priority --- can skip parens only if
    5115             :                      * we have (a - b) - c, not a - (b - c).
    5116             :                      */
    5117           0 :                     if (node == (Node *) linitial(((OpExpr *) parentNode)->args))
    5118           0 :                         return true;
    5119             : 
    5120           0 :                     return false;
    5121             :                 }
    5122             :                 /* else do the same stuff as for T_SubLink et al. */
    5123             :             }
    5124             :             /* FALLTHROUGH */
    5125             : 
    5126             :         case T_SubLink:
    5127             :         case T_NullTest:
    5128             :         case T_BooleanTest:
    5129             :         case T_DistinctExpr:
    5130           0 :             switch (nodeTag(parentNode))
    5131             :             {
    5132           0 :                 case T_FuncExpr:
    5133             :                     {
    5134             :                         /* special handling for casts */
    5135           0 :                         CoercionForm type = ((FuncExpr *) parentNode)->funcformat;
    5136             : 
    5137           0 :                         if (type == COERCE_EXPLICIT_CAST ||
    5138             :                             type == COERCE_IMPLICIT_CAST)
    5139           0 :                             return false;
    5140           0 :                         return true;    /* own parentheses */
    5141             :                     }
    5142           0 :                 case T_BoolExpr:    /* lower precedence */
    5143             :                 case T_SubscriptingRef: /* other separators */
    5144             :                 case T_ArrayExpr:   /* other separators */
    5145             :                 case T_RowExpr: /* other separators */
    5146             :                 case T_CoalesceExpr:    /* own parentheses */
    5147             :                 case T_MinMaxExpr:  /* own parentheses */
    5148             :                 case T_XmlExpr: /* own parentheses */
    5149             :                 case T_NullIfExpr:  /* other separators */
    5150             :                 case T_Aggref:  /* own parentheses */
    5151             :                 case T_GroupingFunc: /* own parentheses */
    5152             :                 case T_WindowFunc:  /* own parentheses */
    5153             :                 case T_CaseExpr:    /* other separators */
    5154           0 :                     return true;
    5155           0 :                 default:
    5156           0 :                     return false;
    5157             :             }
    5158             : 
    5159           0 :         case T_BoolExpr:
    5160           0 :             switch (nodeTag(parentNode))
    5161             :             {
    5162           0 :                 case T_BoolExpr:

    5182             :                     }

    5216             : 
    5217             : /*
    5218             :  * appendContextKeyword - append a keyword to buffer
    5219             :  *
    5220             :  * If prettyPrint is enabled, perform a line break, and adjust indentation.
    5221             :  * Otherwise, just append the keyword.
    5222             :  */
    5223             : static void
    5224       63677 : appendContextKeyword(deparse_context *context, const char *str,
    5225             :                      int indentBefore, int indentAfter, int indentPlus)
    5226             : {
    5227       63677 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    5228             : 
    5229       63677 :     if (PRETTY_INDENT(context))
    5230             :     {
    5231             :         int         indentAmount;
    5232             : 
    5233           0 :         context->indentLevel += indentBefore;
    5234             : 
    5235             :         /* remove any trailing spaces currently in the buffer ... */
    5236           0 :         removeStringInfoSpaces(buf);
    5237             :         /* ... then add a newline and some spaces */
    5238           0 :         appendStringInfoChar(buf, '\n');
    5239             : 
    5240           0 :         if (context->indentLevel < PRETTYINDENT_LIMIT)
    5241           0 :             indentAmount = Max(context->indentLevel, 0) + indentPlus;
    5242             :         else
    5243             :         {
    5244             :             /*
    5245             :              * If we're indented more than PRETTYINDENT_LIMIT characters, try
    5246             :              * to conserve horizontal space by reducing the per-level
    5247             :              * indentation.  For best results the scale factor here should
    5248             :              * divide all the indent amounts that get added to indentLevel
    5249             :              * (PRETTYINDENT_STD, etc).  It's important that the indentation
    5250             :              * not grow unboundedly, else deeply-nested trees use O(N^2)
    5251             :              * whitespace; so we also wrap modulo PRETTYINDENT_LIMIT.
    5252             :              */
    5253           0 :             indentAmount = PRETTYINDENT_LIMIT +
    5254           0 :                 (context->indentLevel - PRETTYINDENT_LIMIT) /
    5255             :                 (PRETTYINDENT_STD / 2);
    5256           0 :             indentAmount %= PRETTYINDENT_LIMIT;
    5257             :             /* scale/wrap logic affects indentLevel, but not indentPlus */
    5258           0 :             indentAmount += indentPlus;
    5259             :         }
    5260           0 :         appendStringInfoSpaces(buf, indentAmount);
    5261             : 
    5262           0 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, str);
    5263             : 
    5264           0 :         context->indentLevel += indentAfter;
    5265           0 :         if (context->indentLevel < 0)
    5266           0 :             context->indentLevel = 0;
    5267             :     }
    5268             :     else
    5269       63677 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, str);
    5270       63677 : }
    5271             : 
    5272             : /*
    5273             :  * removeStringInfoSpaces - delete trailing spaces from a buffer.
    5274             :  *
    5275             :  * Possibly this should move to stringinfo.c at some point.
    5276             :  */
    5277             : static void
    5278           0 : removeStringInfoSpaces(StringInfo str)
    5279             : {
    5280           0 :     while (str->len > 0 && str->data[str->len - 1] == ' ')
    5281           0 :         str->data[--(str->len)] = '\0';
    5282           0 : }
    5283             : 
    5284             : /*
    5285             :  * get_rule_expr_paren  - deparse expr using get_rule_expr,
    5286             :  * embracing the string with parentheses if necessary for prettyPrint.
    5287             :  *
    5288             :  * Never embrace if prettyFlags=0, because it's done in the calling node.
    5289             :  *
    5290             :  * Any node that does *not* embrace its argument node by sql syntax (with
    5291             :  * parentheses, non-operator keywords like CASE/WHEN/ON, or comma etc) should
    5292             :  * use get_rule_expr_paren instead of get_rule_expr so parentheses can be
    5293             :  * added.
    5294             :  */
    5295             : static void
    5296       70157 : get_rule_expr_paren(Node *node, deparse_context *context,
    5297             :                     bool showimplicit, Node *parentNode)
    5298             : {
    5299             :     bool        need_paren;
    5300             : 
    5301       70157 :     need_paren = PRETTY_PAREN(context) &&
    5302           0 :         !isSimpleNode(node, parentNode, context->prettyFlags);
    5303             : 
    5304       70157 :     if (need_paren)
    5305           0 :         appendStringInfoChar(context->buf, '(');
    5306             : 
    5307       70157 :     get_rule_expr(node, context, showimplicit);
    5308             : 
    5309       70157 :     if (need_paren)
    5310           0 :         appendStringInfoChar(context->buf, ')');
    5311       70157 : }
    5312             : 
    5313             : /* ----------
    5314             :  * get_rule_expr            - Parse back an expression
    5315             :  *
    5316             :  * Note: showimplicit determines whether we display any implicit cast that
    5317             :  * is present at the top of the expression tree.  It is a passed argument,
    5318             :  * not a field of the context struct, because we change the value as we
    5319             :  * recurse down into the expression.  In general we suppress implicit casts
    5320             :  * when the result type is known with certainty (eg, the arguments of an
    5321             :  * OR must be boolean).  We display implicit casts for arguments of functions
    5322             :  * and operators, since this is needed to be certain that the same function
    5323             :  * or operator will be chosen when the expression is re-parsed.
    5324             :  * ----------
    5325             :  */
    5326             : static void
    5327      275085 : get_rule_expr(Node *node, deparse_context *context,
    5328             :               bool showimplicit)
    5329             : {
    5330      275085 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    5331             : 
    5332      275085 :     if (node == NULL)
    5333           0 :         return;
    5334             : 
    5335             :     /* Guard against excessively long or deeply-nested queries */
    5336      275085 :     CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS();
    5337      275085 :     check_stack_depth();
    5338             : 
    5339             :     /*
    5340             :      * Each level of get_rule_expr must emit an indivisible term
    5341             :      * (parenthesized if necessary) to ensure result is reparsed into the same
    5342             :      * expression tree.  The only exception is that when the input is a List,
    5343             :      * we emit the component items comma-separated with no surrounding
    5344             :      * decoration; this is convenient for most callers.
    5345             :      */
    5346      275085 :     switch (nodeTag(node))
    5347             :     {
    5348       13354 :         case T_Var:
    5349       13354 :             (void) get_variable((Var *) node, 0, false, context);
    5350       13354 :             break;
    5351             : 
    5352      205596 :         case T_Const:
    5353      205596 :             get_const_expr((Const *) node, context, 0);
    5354      205596 :             break;
    5355             : 
    5356           0 :         case T_Param:
    5357           0 :             get_parameter((Param *) node, context);
    5358           0 :             break;
    5359             : 
    5360        1243 :         case T_Aggref:
    5361        1243 :             get_agg_expr((Aggref *) node, context, (Aggref *) node);
    5362        1243 :             break;
    5363             : 
    5364           0 :         case T_GroupingFunc:
    5365             :             {
    5366           0 :                 GroupingFunc *gexpr = (GroupingFunc *) node;
    5367             : 
    5368           0 :                 appendStringInfoString(buf, "GROUPING(");
    5369           0 :                 get_rule_expr((Node *) gexpr->args, context, true);
    5370           0 :                 appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    5371             :             }
    5372           0 :             break;
    5373             : 
    5374           0 :         case T_WindowFunc:
    5375           0 :             get_windowfunc_expr((WindowFunc *) node, context);
    5376           0 :             break;
    5377             : 
    5378           0 :         case T_SubscriptingRef:
    5379             :             {
    5380           0 :                 SubscriptingRef *sbsref = (SubscriptingRef *) node;
    5381             :                 bool        need_parens;
    5382             : 
    5383             :                 /*
    5384             :                  * If the argument is a CaseTestExpr, we must be inside a
    5385             :                  * FieldStore, ie, we are assigning to an element of an array
    5386             :                  * within a composite column.  Since we already punted on
    5387             :                  * displaying the FieldStore's target information, just punt
    5388             :                  * here too, and display only the assignment source
    5389             :                  * expression.
    5390             :                  */
    5391           0 :                 if (IsA(sbsref->refexpr, CaseTestExpr))
    5392             :                 {

    5394           0 :                     get_rule_expr((Node *) sbsref->refassgnexpr,
    5395             :                                   context, showimplicit);
    5396           0 :                     break;
    5397             :                 }
    5398             : 
    5399             :                 /*

    5401             :                  * FieldSelect.  (In particular, if it's another
    5402             :                  * SubscriptingRef, we *must* parenthesize to avoid
    5403             :                  * confusion.)
    5404             :                  */
    5405           0 :                 need_parens = !IsA(sbsref->refexpr, Var) &&
    5406           0 :                     !IsA(sbsref->refexpr, FieldSelect);
    5407           0 :                 if (need_parens)
    5408           0 :                     appendStringInfoChar(buf, '(');
    5409           0 :                 get_rule_expr((Node *) sbsref->refexpr, context, showimplicit);
    5410           0 :                 if (need_parens)
    5411           0 :                     appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    5412             : 
    5413             :                 /*
    5414             :                  * If there's a refassgnexpr, we want to print the node in the
    5415             :                  * format "container[subscripts] := refassgnexpr".  This is
    5416             :                  * not legal SQL, so decompilation of INSERT or UPDATE
    5417             :                  * statements should always use processIndirection as part of
    5418             :                  * the statement-level syntax.  We should only see this when
    5419             :                  * EXPLAIN tries to print the targetlist of a plan resulting
    5420             :                  * from such a statement.
    5421             :                  */
    5422           0 :                 if (sbsref->refassgnexpr)
    5423             :                 {
    5424             :                     Node       *refassgnexpr;
    5425             : 
    5426             :                     /*
    5427             :                      * Use processIndirection to print this node's subscripts
    5428             :                      * as well as any additional field selections or
    5429             :                      * subscripting in immediate descendants.  It returns the
    5430             :                      * RHS expr that is actually being "assigned".
    5431             :                      */
    5432           0 :                     refassgnexpr = processIndirection(node, context);
    5433           0 :                     appendStringInfoString(buf, " := ");
    5434           0 :                     get_rule_expr(refassgnexpr, context, showimplicit);
    5435             :                 }
    5436             :                 else
    5437             :                 {
    5438             :                     /* Just an ordinary container fetch, so print subscripts */
    5439           0 :                     printSubscripts(sbsref, context);
    5440             :                 }
    5441             :             }
    5442           0 :             break;
    5443             : 
    5444       16750 :         case T_FuncExpr:
    5445       16750 :             get_func_expr((FuncExpr *) node, context, showimplicit);
    5446       16750 :             break;
    5447             : 
    5448           0 :         case T_NamedArgExpr:
    5449             :             {
    5450           0 :                 NamedArgExpr *na = (NamedArgExpr *) node;
    5451             : 
    5452           0 :                 appendStringInfo(buf, "%s => ", quote_identifier(na->name));
    5453           0 :                 get_rule_expr((Node *) na->arg, context, showimplicit);
    5454             :             }
    5455           0 :             break;

    5459       20923 :             break;

    5502           0 :                                  expr->useOr ? "ANY" : "ALL");

    5504             : 
    5505             :                 /*
    5506             :                  * There's inherent ambiguity in "x op ANY/ALL (y)" when y is
    5507             :                  * a bare sub-SELECT.  Since we're here, the sub-SELECT must
    5508             :                  * be meant as a scalar sub-SELECT yielding an array value to
    5509             :                  * be used in ScalarArrayOpExpr; but the grammar will
    5510             :                  * preferentially interpret such a construct as an ANY/ALL
    5511             :                  * SubLink.  To prevent misparsing the output that way, insert
    5512             :                  * a dummy coercion (which will be stripped by parse analysis,
    5513             :                  * so no inefficiency is added in dump and reload).  This is
    5514             :                  * indeed most likely what the user wrote to get the construct
    5515             :                  * accepted in the first place.
    5516             :                  */
    5517           0 :                 if (IsA(arg2, SubLink) &&
    5518           0 :                     ((SubLink *) arg2)->subLinkType == EXPR_SUBLINK)
    5519           0 :                     appendStringInfo(buf, "::%s",
    5520             :                                      format_type_with_typemod(exprType(arg2),
    5521             :                                                               exprTypmod(arg2)));

    5523           0 :                 if (!PRETTY_PAREN(context))
    5524           0 :                     appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    5525             :             }

    5662           0 :         case T_FieldStore:
    5663             :             {
    5664           0 :                 FieldStore *fstore = (FieldStore *) node;
    5665             :                 bool        need_parens;
    5666             : 
    5667             :                 /*
    5668             :                  * There is no good way to represent a FieldStore as real SQL,
    5669             :                  * so decompilation of INSERT or UPDATE statements should
    5670             :                  * always use processIndirection as part of the
    5671             :                  * statement-level syntax.  We should only get here when
    5672             :                  * EXPLAIN tries to print the targetlist of a plan resulting
    5673             :                  * from such a statement.  The plan case is even harder than
    5674             :                  * ordinary rules would be, because the planner tries to
    5675             :                  * collapse multiple assignments to the same field or subfield
    5676             :                  * into one FieldStore; so we can see a list of target fields
    5677             :                  * not just one, and the arguments could be FieldStores
    5678             :                  * themselves.  We don't bother to try to print the target
    5679             :                  * field names; we just print the source arguments, with a
    5680             :                  * ROW() around them if there's more than one.  This isn't
    5681             :                  * terribly complete, but it's probably good enough for
    5682             :                  * EXPLAIN's purposes; especially since anything more would be
    5683             :                  * either hopelessly confusing or an even poorer
    5684             :                  * representation of what the plan is actually doing.
    5685             :                  */
    5686           0 :                 need_parens = (list_length(fstore->newvals) != 1);
    5687           0 :                 if (need_parens)
    5688           0 :                     appendStringInfoString(buf, "ROW(");
    5689           0 :                 get_rule_expr((Node *) fstore->newvals, context, showimplicit);
    5690           0 :                 if (need_parens)
    5691           0 :                     appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    5692             :             }
    5693           0 :             break;

    5813             :                          * The parser should have produced WHEN clauses of the
    5814             :                          * form "CaseTestExpr = RHS", possibly with an
    5815             :                          * implicit coercion inserted above the CaseTestExpr.
    5816             :                          * For accurate decompilation of rules it's essential
    5817             :                          * that we show just the RHS.  However in an
    5818             :                          * expression that's been through the optimizer, the
    5819             :                          * WHEN clause could be almost anything (since the
    5820             :                          * equality operator could have been expanded into an
    5821             :                          * inline function).  If we don't recognize the form
    5822             :                          * of the WHEN clause, just punt and display it as-is.

    5824           0 :                         if (IsA(w, OpExpr))

    5894             : 
    5895             :                 /*
    5896             :                  * If it's a named type and not RECORD, we may have to skip
    5897             :                  * dropped columns and/or claim there are NULLs for added
    5898             :                  * columns.
    5899             :                  */
    5900           0 :                 if (rowexpr->row_typeid != RECORDOID)
    5901             :                 {
    5902           0 :                     tupdesc = lookup_rowtype_tupdesc(rowexpr->row_typeid, -1);
    5903             :                     Assert(list_length(rowexpr->args) <= tupdesc->natts);
    5904             :                 }
    5905             :

    5907             :                  * SQL99 allows "ROW" to be omitted when there is more than
    5908             :                  * one column, but for simplicity we always print it.
    5909             :                  */
    5910           0 :                 appendStringInfoString(buf, "ROW(");
    5911           0 :                 sep = "";
    5912           0 :                 i = 0;
    5913           0 :                 foreach(arg, rowexpr->args)
    5914             :                 {
    5915           0 :                     Node       *e = (Node *) lfirst(arg);

    5918           0 :                         !TupleDescAttr(tupdesc, i)->attisdropped)
    5919             :                     {
    5920           0 :                         appendStringInfoString(buf, sep);
    5921             :                         /* Whole-row Vars need special treatment here */
    5922           0 :                         get_rule_expr_toplevel(e, context, true);
    5923           0 :                         sep = ", ";
    5924             :                     }
    5925           0 :                     i++;
    5926             :                 }
    5927           0 :                 if (tupdesc != NULL)
    5928             :                 {
    5929           0 :                     while (i < tupdesc->natts)
    5930             :                     {
    5931           0 :                         if (!TupleDescAttr(tupdesc, i)->attisdropped)
    5932             :                         {
    5933           0 :                             appendStringInfoString(buf, sep);
    5934           0 :                             appendStringInfoString(buf, "NULL");
    5935           0 :                             sep = ", ";
    5936             :                         }
    5937           0 :                         i++;
    5938             :                     }
    5939             : 
    5940           0 :                     ReleaseTupleDesc(tupdesc);
    5941             :                 }
    5942           0 :                 appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    5943           0 :                 if (rowexpr->row_format == COERCE_EXPLICIT_CAST)
    5944           0 :                     appendStringInfo(buf, "::%s",
    5945             :                                      format_type_with_typemod(rowexpr->row_typeid, -1));
    5946             :             }
    5947           0 :             break;
    5948             : 
    5949           0 :         case T_RowCompareExpr:
    5950             :             {
    5951           0 :                 RowCompareExpr *rcexpr = (RowCompareExpr *) node;
    5952             : 
    5953             :                 /*
    5954             :                  * SQL99 allows "ROW" to be omitted when there is more than
    5955             :                  * one column, but for simplicity we always print it.  Within
    5956             :                  * a ROW expression, whole-row Vars need special treatment, so
    5957             :                  * use get_rule_list_toplevel.
    5958             :                  */
    5959           0 :                 appendStringInfoString(buf, "(ROW(");

    6500             : /*
    6501             :  * get_rule_expr_toplevel       - Parse back a toplevel expression
    6502             :  *
    6503             :  * Same as get_rule_expr(), except that if the expr is just a Var, we pass
    6504             :  * istoplevel = true not false to get_variable().  This causes whole-row Vars
    6505             :  * to get printed with decoration that will prevent expansion of "*".
    6506             :  * We need to use this in contexts such as ROW() and VALUES(), where the
    6507             :  * parser would expand "foo.*" appearing at top level.  (In principle we'd
    6508             :  * use this in get_target_list() too, but that has additional worries about
    6509             :  * whether to print AS, so it needs to invoke get_variable() directly anyway.)
    6510             :  */
    6511             : static void
    6512       19412 : get_rule_expr_toplevel(Node *node, deparse_context *context,
    6513             :                        bool showimplicit)
    6514             : {
    6515       19412 :     if (node && IsA(node, Var))
    6516           0 :         (void) get_variable((Var *) node, 0, true, context);
    6517             :     else
    6518       19412 :         get_rule_expr(node, context, showimplicit);
    6519       19412 : }
    6520             : 
    6521             : /*
    6522             :  * get_rule_list_toplevel       - Parse back a list of toplevel expressions
    6523             :  *

    6525             :  *
    6526             :  * This adds commas between the expressions, but caller is responsible

    6547             : /*
    6548             :  * get_rule_expr_funccall       - Parse back a function-call expression
    6549             :  *
    6550             :  * Same as get_rule_expr(), except that we guarantee that the output will
    6551             :  * look like a function call, or like one of the things the grammar treats as
    6552             :  * equivalent to a function call (see the func_expr_windowless production).
    6553             :  * This is needed in places where the grammar uses func_expr_windowless and
    6554             :  * you can't substitute a parenthesized a_expr.  If what we have isn't going
    6555             :  * to look like a function call, wrap it in a dummy CAST() expression, which
    6556             :  * will satisfy the grammar --- and, indeed, is likely what the user wrote to
    6557             :  * produce such a thing.
    6558             :  */
    6559             : static void
    6560        6656 : get_rule_expr_funccall(Node *node, deparse_context *context,
    6561             :                        bool showimplicit)
    6562             : {
    6563        6656 :     if (looks_like_function(node))
    6564        6656 :         get_rule_expr(node, context, showimplicit);
    6565             :     else
    6566             :     {
    6567           0 :         StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    6568             : 
    6569           0 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, "CAST(");
    6570             :         /* no point in showing any top-level implicit cast */
    6571           0 :         get_rule_expr(node, context, false);
    6572           0 :         appendStringInfo(buf, " AS %s)",
    6573             :                          format_type_with_typemod(exprType(node),
    6574             :                                                   exprTypmod(node)));
    6575             :     }
    6576        6656 : }
    6577             : 
    6578             : /*
    6579             :  * Helper function to identify node types that satisfy func_expr_windowless.
    6580             :  * If in doubt, "false" is always a safe answer.
    6581             :  */
    6582             : static bool
    6583        6656 : looks_like_function(Node *node)
    6584             : {
    6585        6656 :     if (node == NULL)
    6586           0 :         return false;           /* probably shouldn't happen */
    6587        6656 :     switch (nodeTag(node))
    6588             :     {
    6589        6656 :         case T_FuncExpr:
    6590             :             /* OK, unless it's going to deparse as a cast */
    6591        6656 :             return (((FuncExpr *) node)->funcformat == COERCE_EXPLICIT_CALL ||
    6592           0 :                     ((FuncExpr *) node)->funcformat == COERCE_SQL_SYNTAX);
    6593           0 :         case T_NullIfExpr:
    6594             :         case T_CoalesceExpr:
    6595             :         case T_MinMaxExpr:
    6596             :         case T_SQLValueFunction:
    6597             :         case T_XmlExpr:
    6598             :             /* these are all accepted by func_expr_common_subexpr */
    6599           0 :             return true;
    6600           0 :         default:
    6601           0 :             break;
    6602             :     }
    6603           0 :     return false;
    6604             : }

    6987             : /*

    7227             : /* ----------
    7228             :  * get_coercion_expr
    7229             :  *
    7230             :  *  Make a string representation of a value coerced to a specific type
    7231             :  * ----------
    7232             :  */
    7233             : static void
    7234        4581 : get_coercion_expr(Node *arg, deparse_context *context,
    7235             :                   Oid resulttype, int32 resulttypmod,
    7236             :                   Node *parentNode)
    7237             : {
    7238        4581 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    7239             : 
    7240             :     /*
    7241             :      * Since parse_coerce.c doesn't immediately collapse application of
    7242             :      * length-coercion functions to constants, what we'll typically see in
    7243             :      * such cases is a Const with typmod -1 and a length-coercion function
    7244             :      * right above it.  Avoid generating redundant output. However, beware of
    7245             :      * suppressing casts when the user actually wrote something like
    7246             :      * 'foo'::text::char(3).
    7247             :      *
    7248             :      * Note: it might seem that we are missing the possibility of needing to
    7249             :      * print a COLLATE clause for such a Const.  However, a Const could only
    7250             :      * have nondefault collation in a post-constant-folding tree, in which the
    7251             :      * length coercion would have been folded too.  See also the special
    7252             :      * handling of CollateExpr in coerce_to_target_type(): any collation
    7253             :      * marking will be above the coercion node, not below it.
    7254             :      */
    7255        4581 :     if (arg && IsA(arg, Const) &&
    7256        4581 :         ((Const *) arg)->consttype == resulttype &&
    7257           0 :         ((Const *) arg)->consttypmod == -1)
    7258             :     {
    7259             :         /* Show the constant without normal ::typename decoration */
    7260           0 :         get_const_expr((Const *) arg, context, -1);
    7261             :     }
    7262             :     else
    7263             :     {
    7264        4581 :         if (!PRETTY_PAREN(context))
    7265        4581 :             appendStringInfoChar(buf, '(');
    7266        4581 :         get_rule_expr_paren(arg, context, false, parentNode);
    7267        4581 :         if (!PRETTY_PAREN(context))
    7268        4581 :             appendStringInfoChar(buf, ')');
    7269             :     }
    7270        4581 :     appendStringInfo(buf, "::%s",
    7271             :                      format_type_with_typemod(resulttype, resulttypmod));
    7272        4581 : }
    7273             : 
    7274             : /* ----------
    7275             :  * get_const_expr
    7276             :  *
    7277             :  *  Make a string representation of a Const
    7278             :  *
    7279             :  * showtype can be -1 to never show "::typename" decoration, or +1 to always
    7280             :  * show it, or 0 to show it only if the constant wouldn't be assumed to be
    7281             :  * the right type by default.
    7282             :  *
    7283             :  * If the Const's collation isn't default for its type, show that too.
    7284             :  * We mustn't do this when showtype is -1 (since that means the caller will
    7285             :  * print "::typename", and we can't put a COLLATE clause in between).  It's
    7286             :  * caller's responsibility that collation isn't missed in such cases.
    7287             :  * ----------
    7288             :  */
    7289             : static void
    7290      210201 : get_const_expr(Const *constval, deparse_context *context, int showtype)
    7291             : {
    7292      210201 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    7293             :     Oid         typoutput;
    7294             :     bool        typIsVarlena;
    7295             :     char       *extval;
    7296      210201 :     bool        needlabel = false;
    7297             : 
    7298      210201 :     if (constval->constisnull)
    7299             :     {
    7300             :         /*
    7301             :          * Always label the type of a NULL constant to prevent misdecisions
    7302             :          * about type when reparsing.
    7303             :          */
    7304       69988 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, "NULL");
    7305       69988 :         if (showtype >= 0)
    7306             :         {

    7309             :                                                       constval->consttypmod));

    7320      140213 :     switch (constval->consttype)
    7321             :     {
    7322       88274 :         case INT4OID:
    7323             : 
    7324             :             /*
    7325             :              * INT4 can be printed without any decoration, unless it is
    7326             :              * negative; in that case print it as '-nnn'::integer to ensure
    7327             :              * that the output will re-parse as a constant, not as a constant
    7328             :              * plus operator.  In most cases we could get away with printing
    7329             :              * (-nnn) instead, because of the way that gram.y handles negative
    7330             :              * literals; but that doesn't work for INT_MIN, and it doesn't
    7331             :              * seem that much prettier anyway.

    7333       88274 :             if (extval[0] != '-')

    7340       88274 :             break;
    7341             : 
    7342        5499 :         case NUMERICOID:

    7344             :             /*

    7413      140213 :     if (needlabel || showtype > 0)
    7414       50238 :         appendStringInfo(buf, "::%s",

    7420             : 
    7421             : /*
    7422             :  * helper for get_const_expr: append COLLATE if needed
    7423             :  */
    7424             : static void
    7425      210201 : get_const_collation(Const *constval, deparse_context *context)
    7426             : {
    7427      210201 :     StringInfo  buf = context->buf;
    7428             : 
    7429      210201 :     if (OidIsValid(constval->constcollid))
    7430             :     {
    7431       24309 :         Oid         typcollation = get_typcollation(constval->consttype);
    7432             : 
    7433       24309 :         if (constval->constcollid != typcollation)
    7434             :         {
    7435           0 :             appendStringInfo(buf, " COLLATE %s",
    7436             :                              generate_collation_name(constval->constcollid));
    7437             :         }
    7438             :     }
    7439      210201 : }
    7440             : 
    7441             : /*
    7442             :  * simple_quote_literal - Format a string as a SQL literal, append to buf
    7443             :  */
    7444             : static void
    7445       27773 : simple_quote_literal(StringInfo buf, const char *val)
    7446             : {
    7447             :     const char *valptr;
    7448             : 
    7449             :     /*
    7450             :      * We form the string literal according to the prevailing setting of
    7451             :      * standard_conforming_strings; we never use E''. User is responsible for
    7452             :      * making sure result is used correctly.
    7453             :      */
    7454       27773 :     appendStringInfoChar(buf, '\'');
    7455      178061 :     for (valptr = val; *valptr; valptr++)
    7456             :     {
    7457      150288 :         char        ch = *valptr;
    7458             : 
    7459      150288 :         if (SQL_STR_DOUBLE(ch, !standard_conforming_strings))
    7460           0 :             appendStringInfoChar(buf, ch);
    7461      150288 :         appendStringInfoChar(buf, ch);
    7462             :     }
    7463       27773 :     appendStringInfoChar(buf, '\'');
    7464       27773 : }
    7465             :

    7479           0 :         appendStringInfoString(buf, "ARRAY(");

    7481        5219 :         appendStringInfoChar(buf, '(');
    7482             : 
    7483             :     /*

    7485             :      * multiple combining operators.  This is an approximation that could go
    7486             :      * wrong in various scenarios (operators in different schemas, renamed
    7487             :      * operators, etc) but there is not a whole lot we can do about it, since
    7488             :      * the syntax allows only one operator to be shown.
    7489             :      */

    7491             :     {

    7520           0 :                 sep = ", ";
